rename.to: SoftAssertions -> Pass Test if any of the assertion is passed

body:
Not under soft assertions but [`satisfiesAnyOf`](https://www.javadoc.io/static/org.assertj/assertj-core/4.0.0-M1/org.assertj.core/org/assertj/core/api/AbstractAssert.html#satisfiesAnyOf(org.assertj.core.api.ThrowingConsumer...)) might be an option if you have a root instance. Something like:

```java
Person person = new Person(...);
assertThat(person).satisfiesAnyOf(
  p -> assertThat(p.getAge()).as("Age").isGreaterThanOrEqualTo(18),
  p -> assertThat(p.getBirthYear()).as("Birth Year").isGreaterThanOrEqualTo(2005));
```

(manually written â€“ beware of typos ðŸ˜„)

Would that fit your use case?
Thanks for the feedback, @itkhanz. We'll discuss it with the team and let you know.

> What if we provided a new entry point in `Assertions`, like `assertAny(Runnable...)` or `assertAnyOf(Runnable...)`, which would pass only if at least one of the provided `Runnable` doesn't fail?

Yes that would also be fine, infact i was myself not sure how this feature could be achieved with assertJ so i suggested SoftAssertions as wild initial guess, but what you suggested seems to be a better alternative and more intuituve.

Hello, everyone. I hope you all are doing well. 

@scordio can you assign this to me please if possible? Btw this would be my first time oss contribution :). Thanks in advance
@scordio hi there. is this issue still open? I would like to work on it
